column4: does anyone here use hdparm? what is the ubuntu way to save the setting? on debian i would just run a script on startup
but i guess that is even incorrect on debian
the only drive that you can hdparm at boot is /dev/hda the other drivers aren't loaded till after the script runs so for the cdrom devices, you have to run a script at startup
every time I boot I run sudo hdparm -d1u1c1X69 /dev/hda; sudo hdparm -d1u1c1X66 /dev/hdd
thx, i wonder why that isnt standardized ..
